blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Toxatine Toxapex and Mantine fusion Water/Poison Type Ability: Poison Point/Swift Swim Stats: HP - 70, Atk - 55, Def - 130, SpA...
caption:
Toxatine

Toxapex and Mantine fusion

Water/Poison Type

Ability: Poison Point/Swift Swim

Stats: HP - 70, Atk - 55, Def - 130, SpA - 75, SpD - 160, Spe - 60

The Four Winged Pokemon

Toxatine is known as the ‘Wobbuffet of the sea’ as many assume that the growth with a face on its belly is its true face.  It flaps its wings about to scare off predators.  It usually can’t swim fast enough away from its predators so it tries to scare them off using its poisonous spikes.

Request for @mrultra100. I hope you like it! Sorry you had to wait so long for it!

blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - The Scatterbug Family
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - The Scatterbug Family
body:
664: Scatterbug

Again, not the most creative name. But it rolls off the tongue a little bit better than Talonflame. Scatterbug is cute though, if going back to being more run-of-the-mill compared to Gen 5’s Sewaddle and Venipede. Maybe that generation spoiled me there though. Still though, kinda like Bunnelby and Diggersby, Scatterbug is the common larval insect line that I just find the least memorable, once again a shame since it’s by no means a bad design.

Personal Score: 6.5/10

A cute Bugmon.

665: Spewpa

Spewpa’s a little better though. It’s back to the fun “pupae” stages, with Spewpa covering itself in a cloak of fuzz and… whatever the pixel-looking things are supposed to be. I guess given the evolution, they’re supposed to be scales? I dunno. But I do know Spewpa has a pretty fun name to boot.

Personal Score: 7/10

Nice!

…Wait, 665? Pokemon #665? Pokemon Number Six Hundred and Sixty-Five? Oh no. That means… the next Pokemon… is number 666!!! The devil’s number! I can’t do it. I can’t bare to watch. We have to call reviews quits here, folks. I can’t imagine the absolute horrors and abomination that Gamefreak must’ve come up with for Pokemon 666. The thought is too much. Reviews CANCELED.



































No… we’re only a little over 100 of these things left. We’ve come so far, we can’t give up now! I gotta compose myself. Gotta see… it.










666: Vivillon

…Oh.

A slight shame they didn’t come up with some kind of horrible ghastly moth monster for Pokemon 666. But I guess Pokemon’s already got history with being called an Evil Virus of Satan so best dodge that bullet. It’s just funny that Pokemon 666 wound up being precisely this unthreatening looking.

Anyway, Vivillon’s alright. A well enough design, with quite a number of unique things to it. I especially like its eyes. Vivillon here though has a gimmick to it. Depending on which region the Spewpa is caught in, (and I mean physical real region, not Pokemon region.) the pattern on its wings will change. Of course, the one we’re looking at right now, and the one treated as the default, is the French one. It’s a fun gimmick for an otherwise unimpactful Pokemon. I can only imagine this is one that drove Pokedex Completionists crazy.

I do like the pixilated look of its overall appearance though. Some of the wing patterns can look really pretty. It’s a cute way to incorporate a butterfly’s wing-scales into its design. I’ll just say I particularly like Elegant, Garden, Meadow, Ocean, Polar, Savanna, and Sun patterns.

Personal Score: 7.5/10

A nice design anyway. Fun gimmick. Even if me in the US wound up with a rather lackluster design.

Overall:

A fun design for bugs. Maybe if this came after Gen 4 but before Gen 5 I would’ve appreciated it better just because Sewaddle and Venipede were that good.

[Archive]
